docs.title: Essential Installation Prep
docs.text: Flashing a TV is a low-level operation. Precision is required to avoid bricking your hardware.

docs.title: Preparation Checklist
docs.text:
• USB Drive: Formatted to FAT32 (MBR partition table).
  • Port Selection: For best stability, use the USB 2.0 slot (usually white/black). Note: T653 firmware may require a USB 3.0 port.
  • Source: Only use files from verified community links or official TCL support.
  • Environment: Windows, Linux, or Android can be used to extract or copy files. Warning for macOS users: Safari often unzips downloads by default; ensure this is disabled as OTA files must remain zipped.

docs.title: Administration Guide
docs.text: This page is for community administrators and moderators. It explains how to manage the dynamic parts of the TCL Firmware Hub, such as the announcement banner.

docs.title: Managing the Announcement Banner
docs.text: We use a GitHub Actions workflow to update the news banner without touching the code. This ensures even non-developers can push critical updates.

docs.title: 1. Triggering the Update
docs.text:
1. Go to the GitHub Actions Tab.

  2. Click the "Run workflow" button on the right.

  3. Fill in the fields:

    • Show Banner?: Uncheck to hide the banner.
    • Banner Text: The message to display. (e.g., "New V562 Firmware is out!")
    • Link URL: Optional. Link to the Telegram post or download.
    • Date Override: Use YYYY-MM-DD if you want to push a message with a specific timestamp.

docs.title: 2. How it works
docs.text:
• When you click "Run", the workflow updates docs/assets/news.json.

  • The website fetches this file instantly for every visitor.

  • Persistence: If a user clicks "Close" on the banner, they won't see it again until you change the Date. The modern banner.js uses localStorage to remember the dismissal status based on the date string.

docs.title: Maintaining Chipsets
docs.text:
If a new TV model or chipset is released:

  1. Open docs/chipsets.md in the GitHub editor.

  2. Add the new entry to the Mapping Table.

  3. Commit the changes. The site will rebuild automatically in ~2 minutes.

docs.title: Safety & Community Reports
docs.text:
• Scam Alerts: If a new Telegram scam and targeting the group is reported, use the Banner (see above) to push a warning immediately.
  • Broken Links: If the @FirmwareTCLbot is down or links are broken, update the banner to inform users while the dev team works on a fix.

docs.title: Rose Bot Administration
docs.text: The Rose Bot (@MissRose_bot) is our primary automation tool for moderation, filters, and welcome messages. This section explains how admins can interact with and configure the bot.

docs.title: 1. Connecting to the Bot
docs.text:
To manage group settings privately or via the web dashboard, you must first connect your account:

  1. Start the Bot: Message @MissRose_bot and press /start.
  2. Request Connection: In the TCL Discussion Group, type /connect.
  3. Confirm: Rose will send you a PM with a button to confirm the connection. Once connected, you can send commands to her PM instead of the group, keeping the chat clean.

docs.title: 2. Management via Web Dashboard
docs.text:
For complex tasks like editing rules or configuring advanced settings, we recommend the web interface:

  • Dashboard Link: missrose.org/dashboard
  • Setup: After logging in with Telegram, select the TCL Discussion Group from your list.

docs.title: 3. Core Admin Commands
docs.text:
While most things are in the dashboard, you can use these common commands in the group (or PM if connected):

Command Purpose Official Guide /rules View or edit the group rules. Rules Guide /setwelcome Update the randomized welcome msg. Notes/Welcome /filter Add a new keyword trigger. Filters Guide /config Access the general bot configuration. General Setup /adminlist See all authorized group admins. —

Avoid Chat Spam

Whenever possible, use the Web Dashboard or Private Messages to Rose for configuration. Only use commands in the main group for testing or immediate moderation actions.

docs.title: Platforms & Chipsets
docs.text: Identifying your TV's hardware Platform (SoC) is the most critical step before downloading any firmware. Installing a file for the wrong platform will fail at best and brick your TV at worst.

docs.title: Platform Mapping (2026 Sync)
docs.text:
TCL platforms are generally grouped by the year of the model release. Use this table as a reference, but always verify your specific Platform.

Platform Verification

Installing firmware that is too old for your model, even if the platform seems to match, can brick your TV if the firmware doesn't recognize your specific model or Project ID. Always use the latest verified firmware from the bot or community.

docs.title: Modern & Legacy Platforms
docs.text: Platform Family Specific IDs Featured Models Notes / 2025 ID Pentonic 800 — — 0015T01 (Upcoming) T800 / Pentonic 700 T800T02, MT9653 X955 Max, C965, C855 0013T02 T655 / T653 T655T01, T653T01..T03 C655, C655 PRO, C765, P755, R75P 0012T01..T03, 0008T01 T615 T615T01..T03 C645 (Late), P745 2024 Entry-Mid range T221 T221T01..T07, T221T09 S55H, S5200 (Late) 0003T05..T09 RT51 / AT51 R51AT01 P725, C725 Legacy Android R51M / R851 R51MT01..T10 C645, C635, P745 Legacy GTV MT9615 MT9615 C845, C835, C735 High-end Legacy R41K R41KT01 S6500 Series Entry Legacy

docs.title: Regional Platform Mapping (NA vs. Global)
docs.text:
TCL uses significantly different marketing names in North America compared to Europe and the rest of the world (Global). The firmware platforms, however, are often identical.

North America (NA) Global / EU Equivalent Platform ID (Common) QM8 (2024) X955 / C955 Pentonic 700 (MT9653) QM7 (2024) C855 / C805 Pentonic 700 (MT9653) Q7 (2023) C745 / C755 MT9615 / Pentonic 700 R646 (2021) C825 MT9615 S546 (2021) C725 RT51

Verify Platform

Always verify your Platform before flashing. Even if the platform family matches, installing firmware not designed for your specific regional hardware can lead to failures.

[!NOTE] What is a "Platform"? The Platform (e.g., T653, RT51) refers to the underlying System-on-Chip (SoC) and hardware architecture of your TV. It is distinct from the Project ID, which identifies specific panel and model configurations.

docs.title: Decoding Firmware Names
docs.text: Firmware files follow a strict naming convention:

docs.title: Example: V8-R51MT05-LF1V615
docs.text:
1. Release Type:
    • V: Release Version (Stable/Public)
    • R: Test Version (Community/Beta)
    • M: Pre-production Version (Initial Launch)
  2. V8: Standard prefix for Smart TV firmware.
  3. R51MT05: The Platform. This must match your device exactly.
  4. LF1: Region / Language indicator.
  5. V615: The version number.

docs.title: Locating your Platform information
docs.text: For detailed instructions on how to locate your Platform Name and Version (including 2025 formats), please refer to our Firmware Identification Guide.

docs.title: About Project IDs
docs.text:
The Project ID is an internal identifier that can be any positive integer (typically 1 to 6 digits). While important for advanced configuration, your primary focus for firmware selection must always be the Platform.

Full ID Search

If your specific information is not listed in the tables above, use the @FirmwareTCLbot. You can search by Platform String for instant results and verification of compatible models.

docs.text: This website and the associated Telegram Group are community-driven projects. We are a group of enthusiasts dedicated to helping TCL users get the most out of their hardware.

docs.title: Volunteer Effort

docs.title: What we DON'T know
docs.text:
Because we are not TCL employees and do not have access to internal roadmaps, we cannot answer the following questions:

  1. Release Dates: We do NOT know when new firmware updates will be released.
  2. Changelogs: We do NOT have official patch notes. Community reports are our only source of information on changes.
  3. Bug Fixes: We do NOT know when specific software errors or hardware bugs will be officially addressed by TCL.
  4. Major OS Updates: We do NOT know if or when a specific chipset will receive a major Android/Google TV version update (e.g., from Android 11 to 12).

Official Support

If you require official assistance, hardware repairs, or guaranteed support, please contact the Official TCL Support in your specific region.

docs.title: Contributing to TCL Firmware Hub
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing! Whether you are an experienced developer or a complete beginner, this guide will help you set up the project locally, test your changes, and submit your improvements.

docs.title: Getting Started (Local Setup)
docs.text: This project uses MkDocs with the Material theme. Follow these steps to get it running on your machine.

docs.title: 1. Prerequisites
docs.text: You need Python installed on your computer. - Download Python (Ensure you check "Add Python to PATH" during installation).

docs.title: 2. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
Open your terminal (PowerShell or Command Prompt on Windows) and run: 

git clone https://github.com/FaserF/TCL-Discussion-Telegram.git
cd TCL-Discussion-Telegram

docs.title: 3. Setup the Environment
docs.text:
We use a simple script to handle all dependencies for you. Just run: 

.\dev.ps1
This script will: - Check for Python. - Install required libraries (mkdocs-material, pymdown-extensions). - Start a local development server.

docs.title: How to Test Locally
docs.text: Once you run .\dev.ps1, your local version of the site will be available at: http://127.0.0.1:8000/

docs.title: Live Reloading
docs.text: The best part is Live Reloading. Whenever you save a file in the docs/ folder, the browser will automatically refresh to show your changes. You don't need to restart the script!

docs.title: Manual Build Test
docs.text:
To ensure your changes don't have any broken links or errors, run the strict build command: 

python -m mkdocs build --strict

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
Knowing where files are located makes contributing easier:

  • mkdocs.yml: The main configuration file. You can change the site name, navigation, and theme settings here.
  • docs/: This is where all the content lives.
    • index.md: The homepage.
    • guides.md: Detailed installation guides.
    • faq.md: Safety information and FAQs.
    • stylesheets/extra.css: The custom "Premium" design styles.
  • site/: This folder is generated automatically when you build the site. Do not edit files here directly.

docs.title: Making Changes
docs.text:
1. Edit Content: Most of the content is in Markdown (.md). It's a simple text format. You can use any text editor (like Notepad++, VS Code, or even standard Notepad).
  2. Add Images: Place new images in docs/assets/ and link to them using ![Alt text](assets/image.png).
  3. Submit your work: Once you are happy with your changes, commit them to your fork and create a Pull Request on GitHub.

docs.title: Beginner Tip: Using GitHub Desktop
docs.text: If you aren't comfortable with the command line, we recommend using GitHub Desktop. It provides a simple visual interface for cloning, committing, and pushing changes.

docs.title: Contribution Rules
docs.text:
• Be Helpful: Our goal is to make firmware flashing safe for everyone.
  • Verify Info: If you are adding technical details about a chipset or firmware version, please ensure it has been verified in the Telegram group.
  • No Spam: Only content related to TCL firmware and community utilities is allowed.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you get stuck, feel free to ask in the Community Group. We are always happy to help new contributors!

docs.title: Community OTA Extraction Guide
docs.text:
Help the community by capturing and sharing official OTA download links.

Target Group: TCL T653T01 2025 Users

If your TV is offering the V538 (or more recent) OTA update, you can help everyone by extracting the download link before installing it.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• PC & TV connected to the same local network.
  • ADB AppControl installed on your PC (Download Here).
  • WiFi enabled on the TV.

docs.title: 1. Enable Developer Mode & USB Debugging
docs.text:
1. On your TV: Go to Settings > System > About.
  2. Highlight Android TV OS build (or Version) and press the OK button 7-8 times until a message says "You are now a developer".
  3. Go to Settings > System > Developer options.
  4. Enable USB debugging.

docs.title: 2. Connect via ADB AppControl
docs.text:
1. Open ADB AppControl on your PC.
  2. Enter your TV's IP address (find it in Settings > Network) in the top right corner.
  3. Click the Connection button.
  4. Confirm the authorization on your TV screen (check "Always allow from this computer").

docs.title: 3. Start LogCat Capturing
docs.text:
1. In ADB AppControl, go to the Console tab.
  2. Select LogCat on the right side.
  3. Check the box for Debug & Save log to file.
  4. Click Start logcat.

docs.title: 4. Trigger the Update
docs.text:
1. On your TV: Go to Settings > System > About > System Update.
  2. Click Check for Update and wait for it to find the update.
  3. Let it start the download process (you don't need to finish it).

docs.title: 5. Save and Share
docs.text:
1. On your PC: Click Stop logcat in ADB AppControl.
  2. Locate the saved log file.
  3. Send the file to stasiof on Telegram for extraction of the official OTA link.

docs.title: Important Notes
docs.text:
• Don't have the update yet? If you are on an older version (like V509) and want to help, you can capture the log while checking for the update.
  • Already updated? You can still help if you downgrade (using PKG) and then capture the OTA update log during the re-update process.

docs.title: Content Distribution & Credits
docs.text: The information, firmware links, and technical guides provided on this hub and our associated Telegram channels are the result of thousands of hours of collective community research.

docs.title: Redistribution Policy
docs.text: To maintain the integrity of our support system and ensure users always have access to the most up-to-date and verified information, we enforce the following rules:

docs.title: 1. Direct Credits Required
docs.text: You are not permitted to repost firmware links, update files, or technical instructions from our group/channel to other platforms (Telegram, Discord, Forums, or Websites) without: - Explicit Links: You must provide a clear, clickable link back to the original post in our Telegram Channel or Group. - Attribution: Clearly state that the information was sourced from the TCL Firmware Discussion Community.

docs.title: 2. No Mirroring
docs.text: We discourage mirroring our files on third-party cloud storage. Our links are verified and scanned for safety; third-party mirrors cannot be guaranteed by our administration team.

docs.title: Unauthorized Redistribution
docs.text:
It has come to our attention that several Telegram groups and channels are currently scraping our content and reposting it as their own.

  • Status: We have not granted permission to these groups.
  • Concern: Many of these "copy-paste" channels strip away critical safety warnings and chipset identification steps, which leads to users accidentally bricking their televisions.
  • Contact: If you are an administrator of another group and wish to collaborate or share our content legitimately, please contact a moderator in our main discussion group.

docs.title: Our Community Enthusiasts
docs.text: This hub exists because of the tireless work of our Moderators and Admins. If you find this information useful, please support the original source to ensure we can continue providing free, fast, and safe firmware updates for everyone.

docs.title: TCL Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Common technical questions and troubleshooting steps for TCL Android/Google TVs.

How do I find my Project ID or Panel ID?

The Project ID is a unique identifier (typically 1 to 6 digits) specific to your TV's screen size and panel type.

  1. Look at the sticker on the back of the TV.
  2. Check the Service Menu (see Guides).
  3. Ask in the TCL Discussion Telegram with a photo of your model sticker.
What is the difference between Google TV and Android TV?

TCL models from 2021+ mostly use Google TV (a layer on top of Android). Legacy or budget models use Android TV.

  • You can often switch a GTV to "Apps Only" mode in settings to get a cleaner, more ATV-like experience.
Why can't my TV see my 5GHz Wi-Fi?

TCL TVs often have specific requirements for 5GHz networks:

  1. Lower Channels: Most models only support "Lower" 5GHz channels. Set your router to Channels 36, 40, 44, or 48. Higher channels (DFS) are often invisible to the TV.
  2. Hardware Support: Some budget/legacy models only support 2.4GHz Wi-Fi. Check your detailed specs or the Telegram group to verify 5G support for your specific ID.
Is my firmware version outdated?

Firmware versions are usually in the format VXXX (e.g., V560).

  • Higher is newer: V560 is newer than V509.
  • Prefixes: V = Release, R = Test, M = Pre-production.
  • Identification: See our Firmware Identification Guide to learn how to read your version and platform (including new 2025 formats).
  • Check @FirmwareTCLbot to see the absolute latest official version for your Platform.
My TV is slow. How do I speed it up?

Android TVs can become sluggish over time. Try these steps:

  1. Reduce Animations: Go to Developer Options and set all "Animation scale" settings to 0.5x or Off.
  2. Background Process Limit: In Developer Options, set limit to At most 2 processes.
  3. Apps Only Mode: (GTV only) Enable this in Accounts/Settings to remove heavy content recommendations.
  4. Shop Reset: (Last resort) Use code 6425 in the Service Menu to perform a clean system wipe. See What is a Shop Reset? for more details.
What is a Shop Reset?

A Shop Reset (also known as a Factory Reset via Service Menu) is a deep system wipe that bypasses standard OS limitations.

  • When to use: If the TV is stuck in "Shop Mode", if you encounter persistent bugs after a firmware update, or if a standard Factory Reset fails.
  • How to perform:
    1. Open the Service Menu (Settings > Picture > Brightness > Contrast > 6425).
    2. Follow our detailed Reset All & Shop Guide for step-by-step instructions and safety tips.
Where can I find the Play Store?

Since Google TV (v11+) prioritizes content, the Play Store icon might be hidden.

  • Voice Search: Say "Open Play Store" to the remote.
  • Settings: Go to Settings > Apps > See all apps > Show system apps > Google Play Store > Open.
What are Changelogs/Patch Notes?

TCL rarely provides official changelogs for firmware updates. Community members often track changes manually.

  • Follow the News Channel for major update reports.
  • Check the Firmware History in the bot for version numbers.
What is the Game Bar?

The Game Bar is a featureset for 2022+ models (Pentonic/T615) that allows real-time viewing of Refresh Rate (Hz), VRR status, and HDR settings during gaming.

  • Access: Long-press the Settings (gear) or Menu (three lines) button on the remote while an HDMI source is active.
How do I downgrade my firmware?

Downgrading is possible but requires a specific process to avoid bricking your TV.

  • Requirement: You must use an IMG/PKG file for downgrading (except for specific Realtek models).
  • Data Loss: A downgrade will wipe all your apps and settings.
  • Instructions: Please follow the detailed IMG/PKG Flashing Guide.

docs.title: TCL Firmware Installation Guides
docs.text: This page details the standard methods for updating and recovering TCL television hardware.

docs.title: Identify Your Firmware & Platform
docs.text: Before downloading any firmware, you must know your TV's Platform and Version. Installing firmware for the wrong platform can result in a non-functional TV.

docs.title: 1. Where to look
docs.text: On your TV, navigate to: Settings > System > About > Product Information.

docs.title: 2. Traditional Naming Convention
docs.text:
Most TCL firmwares follow a long-string format. Take this example: V8-T615T03-LF1V474.000418

  • Platform: the second part (T615T03). This identifies your hardware.
  • Version: the 3 digits following the "V" (V474).

docs.title: 3. New 2025 Platform Naming
docs.text:
Starting in 2025, TCL has simplified the Platform part of the firmware name displayed in the TV menu. Use the table below to cross-reference new IDs with their traditional platform names:

New ID (TV Menu) Traditional Platform Chassis / SoC 0003T05 T221T05 MT21 0003T09 T221T09 MT21 0008T01 R75PT01 RT75 0012T01 T653T01 MT53 0012T02 T653T02 MT53 0012T03 T653T03 MT53 0013T02 T800T02 T800 0015T01 — MT55

Verification

If your ID is not listed, search for the full firmware string in the TCL Telegram Group or use the Firmware Bot for verification.

docs.title: Flashing Methods Overview
docs.text: There are two primary ways to update or recover a TCL TV. Choosing the right one depends on your goal (upgrade vs. recovery).

docs.title: 1. OTA (Over-The-Air Update)
docs.text:
Best for: Standard version upgrades where you want to keep your data.

  • File Format: .zip or .bin
  • Data Loss: None. Apps and settings are preserved.
  • Process: Performed via the System Update > Local Update menu.

docs.title: 2. IMG / PKG Flash (Recommended for newer models)
docs.text:
Best for: Downgrading, unbricking, or performing a clean system reset.

  • File Format: .img, .pkg, or .zip.
  • Data Loss: Total. All user data is wiped.
  • Process: Performed by holding the hardware power button during cold boot.

Downgrade Logic

Normally, a downgrade should only be done using IMG/PKG firmware. This process will erase all your apps and data.

  • Exception: If your TV uses Realtek hardware with Android 11 or earlier, you can also use an OTA file for downgrade by following the IMG installation instructions (holding the power button).

docs.title: Preparation (Required)
docs.text:
• Format USB: Use a Windows PC to format a USB drive (8GB-32GB) to FAT32.
  • Single File: Ensure only one firmware file is on the root directory of the USB.
  • Slot: For most TVs, use the USB 2.0 slot (white/black). Note: T653 firmware may require a USB 3.0 (blue) port.

docs.title: How to install OTA (.zip) / Local Update
docs.text:
1. Download the correct firmware ZIP file.
  2. Do not unzip. Copy the ZIP file directly to the USB drive.
  3. Plug the USB into the TV.
  4. Navigate to Settings > System > About > System Update > Local Update.
  5. Wait for the validation to finish and follow on-screen prompts.

docs.title: How to Flash IMG / PKG
docs.text:
1. Download the firmware and extract it.
  2. Copy the main file (e.g., Update.pkg) to the root of your USB drive.
  3. Plug the USB into the TV.
  4. Unplug the TV from power.
  5. Press and hold the Power Button on the TV. Location varies:
    • Physical button: Usually directly under the TCL logo or on the back/side.
    • Toggle: Some models use a small joystick; press it straight in.
  6. While holding, plug the TV back in.
  7. Release once the "Software Update" screen appears.

docs.title: Advanced: Service Menus
docs.text:
Service menus allow access to hardware-level parameters, total runtime, and panel calibration.

Code Description 1950 General Service Menu (Design Menu) - Standard for GTV/ATV. 6425 Running Time & Quick access (Reset All / Reset Shop). 9735 Subsection: Factory Menu. 6428 Subsection: Factory Menu (Alternative). 9705 Subsection: Service Menu. 6405 Subsection: Hotel Menu.

docs.title: How to enter:
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Settings > Display & Sound > Picture.
  2. Go to Advanced Settings > Brightness.
  3. Highlight Contrast (do not click).
  4. Type the 4-digit code quickly on the remote. Note: If your remote lacks number buttons, use the on-screen keyboard or a smartphone remote app.

Service Menu Warning

Do not change anything in the Service Menus unless you know exactly what you are doing. Incorrect settings can cause hardware malfunctions or "soft-brick" your device.

docs.title: Reset & Maintenance
docs.text: If you encounter bugs after an update, or if your TV is stuck in a specific mode, use these procedures.

docs.title: Factory Reset
docs.text:
Navigation: Settings > System > About > Reset.

  • IMG / PKG Flash: A factory reset is not required because the flashing process already performs a full system wipe.
  • OTA Update: Since OTA preserves your apps, we only recommend a manual factory reset if you encounter strange bugs or performance issues after the update.

docs.title: Shop Mode / Store Mode
docs.text:
If your TV constantly displays feature banners and resets settings:

  1. Navigate to Settings > System > Environment.
  2. Change from Shop/Store to Home.
  3. Alternatively, you can force-reset this flag through the Service Menu.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
If the TV says "No file found" or fails verification:

  1. Switch USB Drive: Try an older USB 2.0 drive.
  2. Filesystem Check: Re-format to FAT32 on any PC (Windows/Linux) or directly on the TV in the storage settings.
  3. No Subfolders: The .img or .pkg file must be at the very root of the drive.

docs.title: Reset All & Reset Shop Guide
docs.text:
This technical guide explains how to performing deep system resets using the TCL Service Menu (Infotech 0084 procedure). These methods are more thorough than a standard Factory Reset and are often used to resolve persistent software bugs or "Shop Mode" issues.

Data Loss

Both procedures will erase all user data, installed apps, and settings. Ensure any important data or identifiers (like Project ID) are noted before proceeding.

docs.title: Accessing the Service Menu
docs.text:
Before performing a reset, you must first enter the hidden Service Menu:

  1. Press the Settings (gear) button on your remote.
  2. Select Picture and press OK.
  3. Navigate down to Advanced Settings and press OK.
  4. Navigate down to Brightness Settings and press OK.
  5. Highlight the Contrast option (do not change it).
  6. While Contrast is highlighted, type the following code on your remote: 
    6 4 2 5
  7. The Service Menu overlay should appear on the left side of your screen.

docs.title: Reset All vs. Reset Shop
docs.text: The Service Menu provides two distinct reset options. Depending on your issue, you may need one or both.

docs.title: 1. Reset All
docs.text:
This is a standard system-wide data wipe. Use this if your TV is lagging or apps are crashing frequently.

  • Effect: Erases apps and system settings.
  • Procedure:
    • Within the Service Menu, navigate to Reset All.
    • Press the Right Arrow on your remote.
    • Confirm the prompt by selecting OK.
    • The TV will process the reset and may reboot.

docs.title: 2. Reset Shop
docs.text:
This is a more intensive reset that returns the TV to its "Out-of-the-Box" state (First Time Installation).

  • Effect: Completely reinitializes the system storage. Mandatory if your TV is stuck in "Retail/Shop Demo Mode".
  • Procedure:
    • Within the Service Menu, navigate to Reset Shop.
    • Press the Right Arrow on your remote.
    • Confirm the prompt by selecting OK.
    • The TV will turn off and then restart at the initial language/region setup screen.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• Code doesn't work? Ensure you are on the Contrast menu item and typing fairly quickly. If it fails, exit the settings menu and try again.
  • Stuck in Shop Mode? If a standard "Reset All" does not fix the demo mode, the Reset Shop procedure is required.
  • Missing Project ID? Resetting does not typically erase the Project ID (Model Mapping), but it is always good practice to verify it after a reset.

Post-Update Maintenance

After any major firmware update (e.g., from V500 to V600), we highly recommend performing a Reset All to ensure no legacy cache files cause performance issues.

docs.title: Rooting & Custom ROMs
docs.text:
Technical details on modifying the system partition of TCL TVs.

Is Rooting Worth It?

For most users, rooting a TCL Android TV is not worth the risk. Unlike smartphones, TVs don't benefit as much from root, and the risk of a permanent hardware brick is significantly higher. Most "root-only" features (like debloating or custom launchers) can be achieved safely via ADB.

docs.title: The Challenges of TV Rooting
docs.text:
• Closed Bootloaders: Most TCL models have locked bootloaders that cannot be easily opened.
  • Platform Specificity: Root methods are extremely specific to the chipset (SoC) and region.
  • Loss of Warranty: Rooting and unlocking will void your warranty.
  • Broken Features: Widewine L1 (required for Netflix/Prime 4K) is often lost after rooting.

docs.title: Supported Platforms
docs.text:
Currently, only a small subset of Realtek-based platforms have reliable root methods via community-patched images.

Official Rooted Image (RT51 / RT2851)

If you are on the BeyondTV (Android 9) platform, a verified community project exists on XDA.

Official Rooted Image for TCL RT51 / RT2851

If your platform is not listed above, it likely cannot be rooted. Check the TCL Discussion Telegram for the latest research.

docs.title: Switching R51MT02 (ATV) to Google TV
docs.text: Users with the R51MT02 platform (traditionally running Android TV) have the unique option to switch their operating system to Google TV by using the firmware designed for the R51MT05 platform.

docs.title: The Concept
docs.text: The hardware in R51MT02 and R51MT05 models is compatible enough that the R51MT05 Google TV firmware can be run on R51MT02 devices. This allows legacy Android TV users to enjoy the modern Google TV interface.

docs.title: Critical Requirements
docs.text:
1. IMG Method ONLY: You cannot perform this switch using a .zip (OTA) file. Because you are changing the underlying OS structure, a full IMG Flashing Procedure is mandatory.
  2. Full Data Wipe: Flashing an IMG file will erase all your apps, accounts, and settings. Ensure you have backed up any necessary information.
  3. Platform Check: Verify your current Platform before proceeding. This guide is specifically for R51MT02 hardware.

docs.title: How to Switch
docs.text:
1. Download: Obtain a stable R51MT05 IMG firmware file (e.g., V5xx or newer).
  2. Prepare USB: Format a USB drive to FAT32 and copy the .pkg or .img file to the root.
  3. Flash: Follow the IMG / PKG Flashing Guide:
    • Unplug the TV.
    • Press and hold the power button.
    • Plug the TV back in while holding.
    • Release when the update screen appears.
  4. Setup: Once the flash is complete, the TV will boot into the Google TV initial setup screen.

Going Back

If you decide you prefer the original Android TV interface, you can switch back at any time by flashing an original R51MT02 IMG file using the same procedure.

docs.title: Safety & Anti-Scam Guide
docs.text:
Protect yourself from scammers and fake employees.

Fake TCL Private Chats / Employees

Please be aware that unfortunately there are some scammers within our Telegram group who try to contact you via private message and pretend to be a TCL employee or try to charge you for help.

docs.title: Core Safety Rules
docs.text:
• Volunteer Community: This is a free community of volunteer TCL fans.
  • No Direct Contact: We would never charge you for help or contact you directly via private message without speaking with you in the public group first.
  • No Official Employees: There are NO official TCL employees within this group. Anyone pretending to be one in a private chat is a scammer.

docs.title: How to Handle Scammers
docs.text:
1. Do Not Pay: Never send money to anyone claiming to provide "official support" or firmware.
  2. Do Not Share Info: Do not provide personal data or remote access to your TV/PC to strangers.
  3. Report & Block: If you are contacted by such a chat, please report it to Telegram and block the person immediately.

Official Support

If you really need official help, contact TCL via the official channels found on their website. For community help, stay within the @tclupdates_discussion group.

Unfortunately, we cannot prevent these scammers from creating new accounts every day. Stay vigilant!
